data.title: Went out of their way for a group of 16
data.text: We took a large adult group here and asked for a selection of 16 different entree dishes of their choice, and egg rolls. They pushed together tables for the group and another set of tables for the food so we could sample in buffet style. It arrived quickly, was hot, a good mix of spicy and mild, and accompanied by four different sauces. Very friendly wait staff who described each dish for those not familiar with Thai food.

data.title: Excellent Thai Food
data.text: I have dinner here and taken carry out on various occasions. The food is always good. My favorites are the shrimp red curry and the chicken pad Thai.  I really like the Thai iced tea too.  Cost is $$ and worth it.  Staff is always very nice.  Will be back.

data.title: Nice Sunday Lunch
data.text: We stayed in Costa Mesa President Day weekend - Not many Thai restaurants offer lunch prices on Sunday, so we chose this one enar our hotel - the food was delicious, and a good value, the restaurant is small, but nicely appointed - good experience, service was very good

data.title: Best panang curry ever
data.text:
We were two people, both ordered panang curry (one with tofu, one with chicken). It is our favorite dish and we make it as home as well. Panang that we ordered at Diho Siam, was best ever in our experience. Really. The only "issue" I had is that they didn't ask us how spicy we wanted it, but it ended up tasting just right.
We were there for lunch and they had lunch specials (cheaper entrees) that included soup or salad. My vegetable soup was just great. I wish i could eat more and just order an entire big plate of it.
There was some decent music on, it didn't bother. The place was not crowded (mid-week lunch). It looked like a few locals stopped by and ordered something to go. Maybe it was cheaper, I don't know.
The service was prompt and nice. We got our (delicious) food very quickly.

Note: the place is a little hard to find. Look at the buildings' numbers. You'll need the building "number" D.

data.title: Hits the basic Thai dishes
data.text: We did a take away with spring rolls and masaman curry. We liked it very much. The freish rolls were the best.  Next time we will ask for a bit more spice kick

data.title: First time, didn't disappoint
data.text: I'm not a Thai or Chinese food guru but the Chinese menu here was pretty delicious. Everything tasted fresh and not like it came from panda express. While we only ordered from the Chinese menu,the food that was coming out of the kitchen looked delicious. The prices weren't bad either ranging from $8.95 to about $14.95 with most dishes about $9.95. The Chinese fried rice was good but my favorite item ordered was the chicken chop suey. It had a variety of veggies and a delicious white buttery sauce. The dining area was attractive with a contemporary Asian look and tables for outside dining. This is a place i wouldn't mind coming back to.

data.title: My favorite Thai restaurant.
data.text: What makes this my favorite is the authentic taste of the food and the outstanding service by the Thai staff. There is a large variety of dishes on the menu. There is also an abundant Chinese menu but in my many visits here, I've never gotten to the Chinese menu.

data.title: Always a good choice for Thai!
data.text: I've eaten at Diho Siam multiple times for both lunch and dinner, and have never been disappointed.  Note that the restaurant has both a Thai menu and a Chinese menu, and we have always eaten from the Thai menu, so I have no opinion on their Chinese offerings.  The Thai food is quite tasty, and they spice it according to your request.  I love to start with the Thom Ka kai soup, which is a chicken coconut soup flavored with lemongrass and served in a flaming serving bowl.  It's quite addictive.   The other menu choices are pretty standard Thai choices, but I haven't found any yet that my family didn't enjoy.

data.title: Consistantly good - have never been disappointed
data.text: My sister and I keep coming back here because it's just great.  Try the coconut soup and the shrimp WonTon appetizer - you won't be disappointed.  Stick to the Thai - tried the Chinese once and wasn't impressed....
